seo.defaultDescription: A groundbreaking website manifesting the principles of quantum mechanics through interactive visualizations and a dynamic interface.

definitions.waveParticleDuality: A principle of quantum mechanics stating that quantum objects, such as photons and electrons, can exhibit the properties of both particles and waves.
definitions.waveFunction: A mathematical description of the quantum state of a particle. It contains all the probabilistic information about its properties (position, momentum) before a measurement is made.
definitions.waveFunctionCollapse: The sudden transition of a particle's wave function from a state of superposition to a single, definite state as a result of a measurement.
definitions.qubit: The basic unit of quantum information, the quantum analogue of a classical bit. Unlike a bit, it can exist in a superposition of states 0 and 1.
definitions.superposition: The ability of a quantum system (e.g., a qubit) to exist in multiple states simultaneously until a measurement is made.
definitions.quantumEntanglement: A phenomenon where two or more quantum particles become linked in such a way that their fates are intertwined, regardless of the distance separating them.
definitions.spookyAction: A phrase by Albert Einstein describing the paradoxical nature of entanglement, where measuring one particle instantly affects the other, even at a vast distance.
definitions.uncertaintyPrinciple: A fundamental principle stating that there is a limit to the precision with which certain pairs of physical properties of a particle can be known simultaneously.
definitions.momentum: A physical quantity describing an object's motion, being the product of its mass and velocity. In quantum mechanics, it forms an uncertainty pair with position.
definitions.conjugateVariable: A pair of physical quantities (e.g., position and momentum) whose simultaneous measurement to arbitrary precision is impossible due to the uncertainty principle.
definitions.quantumTunneling: A quantum effect where a particle passes through a potential barrier that it classically could not surmount.
definitions.potentialBarrier: A region in space where a particle has higher potential energy, acting like a 'wall' or 'hill' that is classically difficult to cross.
definitions.quantumGate: A basic operation performed on one or more qubits. It is the quantum equivalent of a classical logic gate (e.g., NOT, AND).
definitions.quantumAdvantage: The ability of a quantum computer to solve a specific computational problem significantly faster than the fastest existing classical supercomputer.
definitions.quantumComputing: A type of computation that uses the principles of quantum mechanics, such as superposition and entanglement, to process information in fundamentally new ways.

content.title: Wave-Particle Duality
content.description1: Subatomic particles exhibit dual nature - they can behave both as waves and particles, depending on how they are observed. It is observation that causes the "wave function collapse" - the transition from an undetermined state of possibilities to concrete reality.
content.description2: This website itself is a manifestation of this phenomenon - it existed as a "wave of possibilities" until you made your first interaction, which caused collapse to the present, defined form.

superposition.title: Leap 2: Superposition
superposition.subtitle: Infinite Possibilities
superposition.instruction: Click on the qubit to measure its state. In superposition it can be simultaneously in state |0⟩ and |1⟩!
superposition.superpositionDescription: Qubit exists in superposition of all possible states

entanglement.title: Leap 3: Entanglement
entanglement.subtitle: Cosmic Connection
entanglement.instruction: Hover over one of the entangled particles and observe how the other reacts instantly!
entanglement.principleDescription_part3: , measuring the state of one instantly affects the state of the other, regardless of the distance separating them.
entanglement.applicationsDescription_part2: is the foundation for future technologies:
entanglement.applicationsDescription_part3: , quantum cryptography, and quantum teleportation. It's the basis of the quantum revolution.

uncertainty.title: Leap 4: Uncertainty
uncertainty.subtitle: Limits of Certainty
uncertainty.instruction_part2: : The more precisely we know position, the less precisely we can determine
uncertainty.limitationDescription_part2: does not result from limitations of our measuring instruments, but is a fundamental property of nature. The more precisely we try to measure one quantity, the less precisely we can simultaneously measure a
uncertainty.limitationDescription_part3: . This is not a matter of technology - this is how the universe works at the quantum level.

tunneling.title: Leap 5: Tunneling
tunneling.subtitle: Crossing Barriers
tunneling.instruction: In the quantum world, particles can "tunnel" through barriers that would be insurmountable classically!
tunneling.name: Name
tunneling.successMessage: Your message crossed the quantum barrier
tunneling.tunnelingDescription_part3: that would be insurmountable in classical physics. This phenomenon enables the operation of many modern technologies, from tunnel scanners to nuclear fusion in stars. In our form, it symbolizes overcoming communication barriers!

schrodinger.title: Schrödinger's Cat Experiment
schrodinger.subtitle: The Superposition Paradox
schrodinger.boxStateDescription: The cat is both alive AND dead
schrodinger.paradoxDescription_part1: Schrödinger's thought experiment illustrates the absurdity of applying
schrodinger.paradoxDescription_part2: to the macroscopic scale. The cat in the box is simultaneously alive and dead until we make a measurement. This shows how the act of observation affects quantum reality.

computing.title: Leap 6: Quantum Computers
computing.subtitle: Future of Computing
computing.advantageDescription_part3: to perform calculations that would be practically impossible for classical computers. One
computing.advantageDescription_part4: can be in state |0⟩ and |1⟩ simultaneously, which allows for an exponential increase in computing power with each additional qubit.

applications.title: Leap 7: Quantum Applications
applications.subtitle: Quantum Revolution in Practice
applications.cryptographyDescriptionShort: Unbreakable communication thanks to the laws of quantum physics.
applications.cryptographyDescriptionLong_part2: to create absolutely secure communication channels. Any attempt to eavesdrop is automatically detected.
applications.teleportationDescriptionShort: Transferring quantum states over long distances.
applications.teleportationDescriptionLong: Quantum teleportation allows for the transmission of quantum state information without physically moving the particle. It is the basis for the future quantum internet.
applications.sensingDescriptionLong: Quantum sensors use quantum effects to achieve unprecedented levels of sensitivity, revolutionizing medicine, geology, and navigation.

sections.title: 1. Acceptance of Superposition Terms
content: By using the Quantum Portal, you agree to exist in a superposition of all possible User states. Your interaction causes a wave function collapse into a single, definite state, which is binding until the next interaction.
We reserve the right to entangle these terms with any other terms in the universe. Changes become effective instantaneously across all entangled universes.

sections.title: 2. User Observation and Measurement
content: Every action you take within the Portal is a form of measurement. You agree that the act of your observation may irreversibly alter the state of the observed system. We are not responsible for any paradoxes you might accidentally create.
In accordance with the uncertainty principle, the more precisely we know your position in the Portal, the less we will know about your momentum (and intentions). And vice versa.

sections.title: 3. Tunneling of Liability
content: Any liability for potential side effects of traveling through quantum barriers (such as spontaneously existing in two places at once) is tunneled directly to the User.
The probability of us assuming liability is inversely proportional to the energy barrier of the problem.

privacyPage.subtitle: Your data is both secure and everywhere at once

sections.title: 1. Quantum Data Collection
content: We collect information about your quantum state, including spin, momentum, and position in Hilbert space. Your personal data exists as a probability cloud until we decide to measure it.
We use cookies that may or may not exist until you check your browser's cookie folder, which finalizes their state.

sections.title: 2. Data Entanglement with Third Parties
content: We may entangle your data with that of our trusted partners. This means that measuring their data will instantly affect yours, regardless of the distance. Don't worry, this 'spooky action at a distance' is fully compliant with the laws of physics.
We do not share your collapsed data with third parties without your explicit, deterministic consent.

sections.title: 3. Security and the Black Hole Paradox
content: Your data is stored in a manner analogous to the black hole information paradox. It is both fully accessible to us and irreversibly inaccessible to the outside world.
In the event of a security breach, information about the event will reach you with a delay due to time dilation.
